verses.roman:
sūta uvāca
iti candra-lalāmasya
dharma-gahyopabṛṁhitam
vaco 'mṛtāyanam ṛṣir
nātṛpyat karṇayoḥ piban

synonyms: sūtaḥ uvāca—Sūta Gosvāmī said; iti—thus; candra-lalāmasya—of Lord Śiva, who is decorated with the moon; dharma-guhya—with the secret essence of religion; upabṛṁhitam—filled; vacaḥ—the words; amṛta-ayanam—the reservoir of nectar; ṛṣiḥ—the sage; na atṛpyat—did not feel satiated; karṇayoḥ—with his ears; piban—drinking.
translation: Sūta Gosvāmī said: Drinking with his ears Lord Śiva's nectarean words, full of the confidential essence of religion, Mārkaṇḍeya Ṛṣi could not be satiated.

purport.content: Mārkaṇḍeya Ṛṣi was not eager to hear himself praised by Lord Śiva, but he appreciated Lord Śiva's deep realization of religious principles and therefore desired to hear more.
